claim: Flublok contains 3x the hemagglutinin (HA) antigen content of standard-dose flu vaccines, which has been linked to greater immunogenicity vs standard-dose flu vaccines.
explanation: A table listing various influenza vaccines, including trade name, presentations, age indication, HA antigen content per dose, route, and mercury content. Under RIV4 (recombinant HA vaccine), Flublok Quadrivalent is shown as 45 µg HA per 0.5 mL dose, while standard IIV4 vaccines (e.g., Fluad Quadrivalent) are listed as 15 µg HA per 0.5 mL dose. Evidence: Flublok Quadrivalent contains 45 µg HA per dose versus 15 µg HA per dose in standard-dose IIV4 vaccines. The table shows Flublok contains 3× the HA antigen content of standard-dose vaccines but provides no data on immunogenicity, so it does not support the claim that higher HA content has been linked to greater immunogenicity.
